data.title: The Prince
data.meta_description: The Prince by Stephen Maher - The first comprehensive biography of Justin Trudeau as prime ministerâan honest, compelling story of his governmentâs triumphs ...
data.text:
âMaher delivers a full-length treatment of the Prime Minister and his government that is both comprehensive and insightful. . . Stephen Maher has delivered a thoroughly researched and fair-minded accounting of Justin Trudeauâs accomplishments and failings. If journalism is the first draft of history, The Prince is a convincing second draft.â

â The Globe and Mail

âSensational . . . It deftly captures what went on behind the scenes in Trudeauâs big successes, along with his big failures. The bookâs strengths are in Maherâs interviews with top political players who speak candidly about what itâs really like in political Ottawaâs backrooms. The book is a must-read for anyone interested in politics and the prime minister.â

â The Hill Times

âAn extraordinary book which traces this descent into hell is becoming a hit in English Canada. It's definitely worth reading if you want to understand how Trudeau got so low in the polls today.â

â Le Journal de Montreal

âI just finished Stephen Maher's The Prince and highly recommend it, even to those who closely follow Canadian politics. Itâs the best Justin Trudeau biography Iâve read so far, and it is fair, accurate, and balanced.â

â DON MARTIN, columnist, CTVNews.ca

â[An] engaging and even-handed book on the prime ministerâ

â LAWRENCE MARTIN, Public Affairs Columnist, The Globe & Mail

âThis is a compelling examination of Justinâs time in office.â

â Hello! Canada

âThe Prince is a fast-paced, highly readable political narrative informed by interviews with more than 200 insiders, including Trudeau himself. . . The book carefully plots the downward trajectory of Trudeauâs time in power.â

â Zoomer.com
